storyInfo: Glaucus has an unsuccessful job interview at Raythean Industries.

attributes.content: Hm, tests completed. Everything's running normally.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: And we'll be done once I install the Originium battery set. Where did that go...?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Professor Millais?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Professor who?
Sorry, I got the wrong person. I thought only Professor Millais would come here around this time.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Oh...
You're the only one here. Is this... Raythean Industries' workshop?
Looks like it. That's what the sign said when I walked in.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: You... understand all this high-tech stuff?
Well... A little?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Yo, I got a weapon made by you guys that's broken. Think you can fix it?
You want to get your weapon fixed?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: (Why did his tone change all of a sudden?)
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Can you do it?
(Not even a third of the time I have for this practical exam has passed. Maybe they noticed I finished early and decided to give me a new test?)
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: (So aside from design and modification, you also need to know how to make repairs... Becoming a Raythean equipment designer isn't easy, is it?)
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: What are you spacing out for? Can you do it or not?
I should be able to. What do you need fixed?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: (He's even pretending to be a real customer. Is he evaluating my performance, too?)
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Here.
The warranty card is in the bag, probably at the bottom, under everything.
It says Gordon... Are you Mr. Gordon?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Whoa... I've never seen a weapon like this before.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: It looks like a regular crossbow from the outside, but the whole firing mechanism was overhauled. It's connected to... an EMG sensor!
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: It uses multiple EMG sensors to form a module recognition system that helps users with hand disabilities control the weapon. The design is genius.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: When you wield it, you just need to lift the weapon to the right height, and the sensor module on your upper arm will be able to detect your muscles' movements.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: So by moving their arm, the user can issue commands to control the crossbow's power and firing mechanism. Once they've gotten the hang of it, they could even fire it with no hands whatsoever.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: ...With this design, you could definitely factory-produce weapons for disabled soldiers.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Heh.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: It's those factories that gave me this dud. The EMG sensor you're talking about's broken.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Is it broken? I just plugged it in for a test. It should be working fine.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. If that's not broken, what is?
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: But the test signal...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I don't need to know how it goddamn works! All this high tech stuff goes right over my head. Just fix it!
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: And you better not slack off! I'm telling you I need it back this morning! If I don't get it back...
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Don't worry. Debugging is very simple. It won't take all morning. You can watch me tune it.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Or you could sit somewhere. I'll be done in no time.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: ...Alright.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Uh, about your legs...
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Huh? You mean my exoskeleton?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I've got bad legs. It's thanks to these babies that I can walk.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: What happened?
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: It's genetic.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: So you need to wear those braces all the time... Isn't it painful?
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: I mean, it's definitely not the same as using your own legs, but I'm used to it.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Doesn't Raythean have lots of high tech wheelchairs or whatever? They got those ones that can carry people and run around, or even give you a massage...
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: You could just get one of those. It's gotta be better than putting up with how heavy that metal doohickey is, right?
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: A wheelchair would be more comfortable, but that only gives you mobility.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Is that not enough?
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: I like the feeling of being able to stand up.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Don't get me wrong, a good mobility tool is great, but to me, my exoskeleton is irreplaceable.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: The solid sensation you get from under your feet... How you get propelled forward by the ground when you run... The winds whispering in your ear...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I was thrilled by all the sensations throughout my body when I first walked on the ground with my own two feet.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: It made me truly realize that, instead of floating powerlessly at the mercy of the wind, I'm... actually connected to the land.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Er, sorry for going off on a weird tangent. Pretend I never said that.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: ...You're goddamn right though.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: But... it's too late for me.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Sorry.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: For what?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I mean... Sorry for that outburst just now. I got carried away.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Huh? I don't see anything wrong... Hm...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Mr. Gordon.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Huh? What's the matter?
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Do you use this weapon yourself?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Your hands are injured, right? May I see them?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: ...Alright.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: He presents a pair of timeworn hands. Under the light, his rough skin appears so dull that it is as if it is covered with a layer of ash.
On the back of each hand is a conspicuous scar resembling a valley in the desert.
I only have my thumbs left. Can't move the others.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: These calluses on your fingers... You're an outstanding mercenary, aren't you?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Heh.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: A year ago, I got careless on a mission in Rim Billiton. Those bastards drove me into a corner, and they cut the tendons in my hands.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: I only have myself to blame for wasting all my money every payday. I had nothing saved up, and when it came time for my treatment, I had to take on an ass load of debt, and this is what I ended up with.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: ...Can't even pull a trigger. Now I need a toy crossbow like this to make a living and pay off my debts.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: A good-for-nothing like me's always gonna be down on his luck. In the end, even this toy is turning its back on me, making me watch, helpless... *spit*.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Hah, but whatever. After today... it'll finally be over. Everything I should've ended a long time ago.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Um... If you don't mind, I have an idea.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I could help you modify your weapon to make it easier to use.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Whatever works. Long as it shoots bolts when I need it to.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Ten minutes later...
That should do it. Here.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Is it good to go?
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Well, I'm done modding it...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Who on Terra thought to hold a media day? What is even the point of these things? What a bunch of crap!
attributes.name: Voice Outside the Door

attributes.content: I have enough to worry about as it is. If it weren't for the recommendation, I wouldn't have even entertained interviewing anyone today.
attributes.name: Voice Outside the Door

attributes.content: Is someone coming?!
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: That's probably Professor Millais.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Quick! Give me the crossbow!
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Huh? Wait!
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I haven't told you how to use the new module yet
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Miss Glaucus.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Miss Glaucus!
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Oh, sorry. You mentioned the practical exam, and it reminded me of what happened back then.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: It's fine. My next...
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Look at all the snacks you've got in this basket. Do you usually hold back from munching on them during interviews?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I'm... not a fan of snacks.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Is it okay I have a lollipop, then?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: ...By all means.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: My next question is, as all our research and development here is team-based, what do you think of group R&D?
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: You mean everyone here works as a team? That sounds pretty good to me.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: When I worked at Rhodes Island, I often worked as a group, so I suppose I do have experience in that area.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: When you worked with others before, did your team members say anything about your performance?
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Oh, yes, they did. I think some of them said... uh...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: That I should work on my own.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I have no more questions. Do you have any questions for me?
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: If not, then we'll...
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: (Hold on. Closure went over this. At the very end, when it's my turn to ask questions, I should ask the interviewer what they thought about me. That'll give me a good idea of whether I'll pass or not.)
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: So... what do you think about me?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: (Deep breath)
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: You have proven your talent in engineering as a professional equipment designer.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Your answers in your field of expertise during the interview and your performance during the test were both practically perfect, and your ideas in the applications of electromagnets are very imaginative.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: However, I find that your work habits and the direction of your research are somewhat different from what we have in mind.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: For example, you insist on spending much of your energy on tuning and personalizing equipment, and it's reflected in your designs.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: You customize your modules to the user's needs. This introduces complexities to the design, but the issues they are intended to address may very well be ones that the user could have gotten used to over time.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: To tell you the truth, I don't think that's a bad thing, but when you design based around that logic, the additional costs don't result in additional profits. Furthermore, such designs cannot be produced on the assembly line.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: In the end, Raythean Industries is a large corporation, and we aren't lacking in geniuses here.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Moreover, your work style is rather... unique. I'll have to think more about how well you'd perform in a team. That's more or less it.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Let's wrap it up here for today. All you need to do now is head home and wait for us to contact you. You may rest here for the time being. Someone from HR will escort you out later.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: I have other things to attend to. Now if you'll excuse me.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Oh, okay.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Oh yes, and you may help yourself to the snacks in the basket.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: (Sounds like this one's a bust. I guess I'll be helping Closure out for the foreseeable future.)
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: (Oh well. Heading back isn't so bad, but let me have something to eat first.)
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Excuse me. I'm here to take out the garbage.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: You're...
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: It's you...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Oh, I get it.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: They must've asked you to participate in my test this morning out of nowhere, right? Thank you for your work.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Your hands... Does it ever get in the way?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I can still hold the tools I need to.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Oh, right. Your weapon...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Shh, move.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: You have paper shreds next to you.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Alright, my job here is done.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Thanks for your help this morning. My dream has come true. From here on out, pretend like you've never seen me before.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: That's it. Goodbye.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Wait
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: (That's strange... Wasn't he here this morning... to help evaluate me?)
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Sorry for the wait. Let me walk you outside.
attributes.name: HR Employee

attributes.content: Oh, okay.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Right, we have a media day today. If you'd like, I could show you around our company's various departments.
attributes.name: HR Employee

attributes.content: This is our division's outdoor test site, and it's where we test out the capabilities of all the equipment and weapons we develop, and get the data for our designers to iterate upon.
attributes.name: HR Employee

attributes.content: The weapon you put together this morning was also tested here by our professionals. It was pretty well-received all around.
attributes.name: HR Employee

attributes.content: The weapon... Just one?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Yeah, that EMP field launcher. The idea of striking the enemy's tactical equipment was very creative. A couple of our senior designers in attendance were really inspired.
attributes.name: HR Employee

attributes.content: They all said that the last time they saw such an impressive design was when Professor Millais submitted his, right after he was reassigned here from HQ.
attributes.name: HR Employee

attributes.content: No way...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Can't imagine it, can you? Professor Millais is a genius, through and through. In just a few short years, he created multiple successful product lines for our division, and our profits saw a ten-fold growth.
attributes.name: HR Employee

attributes.content: No... That's not what I meant. What kind of tests do you normally give everyone who applies for the position?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Uh... I can't say.
attributes.name: HR Employee

attributes.content: Do they ever have to work with someone pretending to be a customer?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I can't recall anything like that happening...
attributes.name: HR Employee

attributes.content: Whoops, I may have, uh, presented myself as
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Oh, looks like the media tour's just made it here, too. And there's Professor Millais.
attributes.name: HR Employee

attributes.content: Let's wait here a little and let them head on over first.
attributes.name: HR Employee

attributes.content: Huh? Why is there still a janitor here? I thought they were going to have everything cleaned up before the media got here.
attributes.name: HR Employee

attributes.content: Mr. Gordon? That bag on his cart!
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Stop that janitor!
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: HR Employee

attributes.content: It's too late...
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Mr. Gordon!
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: At the very front of the group of visitors, the inconspicuous janitor suddenly removes his disguise and unleashes his original strength.
With everyone completely defenseless, none of them are able to escape the veteran mercenary's assault.
In a flash, he already has Professor Millais in a chokehold.
Emergency defense system activated!
attributes.name: Raythean Industries Security

attributes.content: Don't move! If I see any of you move an inch, he's dead!
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: You hear him? Don't move!
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: ...So fast to cave, huh?
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Don't worry, Professor! You designed our defense system. It can shoot the hostage taker with no risk!
attributes.name: Raythean Industries Security

attributes.content: Shut up... Just do as he says!
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: *cough*... I had them stand down. They'll follow your orders. They do whatever I tell them anyway... So can you relax your grip a little? I can hardly breathe.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: *cough*... You disguised yourself as a janitor and infiltrated us all this time, choosing this specific day to take me hostage... *cough*... instead of just killing me.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: There's something you're after, isn't there?
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: You're clever, I'll give you that.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Is it money? Or something else? Whatever it is, we can satisfy your demands.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Good!
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Listen up, all of you! I have two demands!
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: First, for Raythean Industries.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Transfer 20 million Victorian pounds to the bank account on this strip of paper. Now!
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Assistant. Bring me my terminal. I'll pay him with my personal account.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Immediately!
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Here, Professor.
attributes.name: Professor's Assistant

attributes.content: ...Here's the receipt.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Good. Efficient. That's a mega corp for you.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: *cough*... I fulfilled your first demand. What's the other?
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: My second demand is for all the members of the media in attendance!
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: What...?
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: I want you all to report what I'm about to say, word for word.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: He might very well damage our company's reputation! This could be a disaster!
attributes.name: Raythean Industries Security

attributes.content: Sorry, Professor! We have to activate the defense system. Trust us. It can handle threats of this level!
attributes.name: Raythean Industries Security

attributes.content: Wait! Don't do it!
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Professor!
attributes.name: Raythean Industries Security

attributes.content: Dammit! That's a 'Raythean Navigator Mk. I' tactical crossbow! I'm the one who designed it!
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: It's controlled via multiple EMG sensors. It's 300 times faster than pulling the trigger by hand!
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: At this distance, if he wants to shoot me, the system won't stop him in time!
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: So it was you...
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Hahahahaha.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: What... What are you trying to say?
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: I've been looking for this weapon's designer for a very long time.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Everyone, I'm former specialist mercenary Gordon Bounou of Dakfung Security. I lost the use of my hands in an accident, so I was supplied a 'Raythean Navigator Mk. I' tactical crossbow.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: But I never expected that this half-baked, defective product would lead to an outcome I could never take back.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Because it wouldn't shoot properly... I had no choice but to watch my... subordinate die...
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Impossible...
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: That account you just transferred the money into is his family's. That's what Raythean owes him! You have to take full responsibility for his death!
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Raythean Industries... this black-hearted company... and you, you bastard! For letting your unreliable weapons enter the market while you watch your stock prices go up from your offices...
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: All of you assholes deserve to die!
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Too bad for you... No way I could've dealt with all of you, but looks like fate's on my side. I caught you.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Don't be hasty! There must be some kind of misunderstanding!
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: That weapon cannot be defective! I tested it myself!
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Shut up! I...
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Try launching a bolt. Just give it a try.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: What are you doing? Are you trying to get me killed?!
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Stay back! This has nothing to do with you!
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: No, I'm saying you should try firing your crossbow.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Firing my...
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Right... I've come this far. There's no turning back.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: I lived half my life as a merc. I live and die by the crossbow... My life came to an end the day I lost the use of my hands.
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: But now I have this bastard right here in my grip. If I can at least drag him down with me...
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Wait! Don't do it!
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: ...Fire it.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Perhaps trying to look better in death, the man forces himself to smile, at least a little.
He contracts the muscles in his upper arm as he's practiced before, making no mistakes in the action.
In less than one three-hundredth of a second, the crossbow will fire, and its bolt will pierce his hostage's body.
Then, he will swallow the poison pill in his mouth, and everything will end exactly the way he envisioned.
Yet nothing happens.
What... How come...?
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Help!
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Quick! Don't let him get away!
attributes.name: Raythean Industries Security

attributes.content: He's got something in his mouth! Open it up! Don't let him kill himself!
attributes.name: Raythean Industries Security

attributes.content: After a brief commotion, the crisis finally comes to an end.
Get off me! Get off!
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: No way... Why...? Why didn't it fire again?!
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: What did you do? Didn't you say you fixed it?!
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: I didn't fix it, I modded it. To make it... suit you better.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: She leans down and picks up the weapon that she modified herself.
The 'Returner.' That's the name she came up with for it.
She fastens the custom-made ringband that went ignored around her hand, and assumes a shooting stance.
Then, she pulls the trigger.
This...
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Don't move!
attributes.name: Raythean Industries Security

attributes.content: Get off me! Let me see! Let me see her!
attributes.name: Gordon

attributes.content: Relax your hold on him a little. Let him see... but don't let him go!
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: I was trying to tell you how to use it after I modded it, but I didn't get the chance.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: After seeing your hands, I figured that as a veteran, pulling the trigger has to be the action you're most familiar with, right?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: You've been on thousands of missions and come back from danger countless times, so I knew that being able to shoot accurately and instinctively has to be the one thing you can count on the most.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: So when I saw that you can still move your thumb, I made a little change.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Instead of relying on the EMG sensor, I added a ringband that stands in for the trigger being pulled.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: That way, you can pull the trigger yourself and fire your crossbow the way you're most familiar with.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Professor, is it alright if we let him try it?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: ...Keep him under control.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Here, put this on. Give it a try.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: How is it? Not bad, huh?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: There is no answer.
He simply lets the tears in his eyes run down his face.
Professor, the results of the investigation are in.
attributes.name: Professor's Assistant

attributes.content: A mercenary called Gordon did indeed use our 'Raythean Navigator Mk. I' during a mission. It was bought wholesale by Dakfung Security for their disabled soldiers.
attributes.name: Professor's Assistant

attributes.content: And the mission did turn out as he said. Six months ago, a 23 years old mercenary was killed by rioters because the man wasn't able to fire his weapon in time.
attributes.name: Professor's Assistant

attributes.content: After the incident, he left Dakfung Security and used one of the fake identities he used as a mercenary to apply to become a janitor at our division.
attributes.name: Professor's Assistant

attributes.content: He'd been planning this for a very long time. He was going to commit suicide during our media day, and lay all the blame on our company.
attributes.name: Professor's Assistant

attributes.content: Since we outsourced janitorial work to a service company, we didn't discover his plan in time. This oversight is our security department's responsibility, and we'll make sure that they take the necessary precautions going forward.
attributes.name: Professor's Assistant

attributes.content: Necessary precautions... If it weren't for that candidate modifying his weapon, I would've been killed!
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: I'm truly sorry!
attributes.name: Professor's Assistant

attributes.content: Never mind... Did you bring the report regarding the mission he was on?
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Here it is.
attributes.name: Professor's Assistant

attributes.content: Did the 'Navigator Mk. I' really malfunction...?
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Based on the operational logs we exported from the unit, it seems... it was working as intended.
attributes.name: Professor's Assistant

attributes.content: And Dakfung Security's internal investigation report shows that the real reason behind that incident was that the mercenary subconsciously wanted to pull the trigger...
attributes.name: Professor's Assistant

attributes.content: ...and failed.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: It's a good thing he didn't get his way. I mean, I knew there could never be a problem with your design.
attributes.name: Professor's Assistant

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Announce to the public that his weapon malfunctioned and caused the accident. That we sincerely regret this and will take full responsibility.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: What? Professor!
attributes.name: Professor's Assistant

attributes.content: Now leave, and do as I said. I'll pay for any compensation out of my own pocket.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Understood.
attributes.name: Professor's Assistant

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: That's fine with you, right boss?
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Mhm.
Is there anything else you want to say?
Of course, I also wanted to talk to you about the new candidate, Glaucus. Didn't you contact me because of her?
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: She may have saved my life, but my judgment is still that she's not fit to be an equipment designer.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: Her design philosophy simply can't develop the sort of products that could expand our company or increase our profit margins.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: I know.
But she is indeed a genius, and your headquarters can't let talents like her slip by.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: I will send someone to sign a cooperation agreement with her and sign her on as a advanced weapon evaluator. She will be in charge of tuning the latest weapons, and all the company's most innovative research will be made available to her.
Good. That's a much better position for her.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: 'A technology company should strive to better serve the masses with technology.' I remember you saying that during your interview, years ago.
Right. I wonder how I turned out the way I am now.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: When I interviewed Glaucus, I asked her the same question. How she sees the relationship between technology and people.
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: And her answer was...
attributes.name: Millais

attributes.content: 'Technology may have forged my legs, but it's only when I run that they have meaning.'
attributes.name: Millais
